Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator McClure with amendments and an amendment to the title. With written report No. 98-420.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 813.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands, Reserved Water and Resource Conservation

official_title: A bill to amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act by designating the Wildcat River for study as a National Wild and Scenic River.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources with amendment, S. Rept. 98-420) Amends the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to add the Wildcat Brook, New Hampshire, (from its headwaters, including the principal tributaries, to its confluence with the Ellis River) to the list of rivers designated for potential addition to the national wild and scenic rivers system. Directs that: (1) the study relating to such addition be completed no later than two years from the date of enactment of this amendment; and (2) an interim report be submitted to the Congress no later than one year from the date of enactment of this amendment.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act by designating the Wildcat River for study as a National Wild and Scenic River.
